Clause: The Element metaclass defines a tagged value documentation for comment
Whole Sentence: The Element metaclass defines a tagged value documentation for comment, description or explanation of the element to which it is attached.

Clause: tagged value applies to every model element
Whole Sentence: Since this tagged value applies to every model element, it is given its own tab in the details pane, rather than being part of the Tagged Values tab.

Clause: whether this model element is deprecated
Whole Sentence: A check box to indicate whether this model element is deprecated (i. e. planned for removal in future versions of the design model).

Clause: Pointers to documentation outside the system
Whole Sentence: Pointers to documentation outside the system.

Clause: Literal text of any documentation
Whole Sentence: Literal text of any documentation.

Clause:
Model elements that do not have any specific direct graphical representation on the screen (beyond their
textual description) do not have style tabs of their own
Whole Sentence: Model elements that do not have any specific direct graphical representation on the screen (beyond their textual description) do not have style tabs of their own.

Clause: This checkbox allow to display or hide the path in front of the name of the modelelement
Whole Sentence: Path This checkbox allow to display or hide the path in front of the name of the modelelement.

Clause: This checkbox allows to hide or show the attributes compartment of a class
Whole Sentence: Attributes This checkbox allows to hide or show the attributes compartment of a class.

Clause: This checkbox allows to hide or show the operations compartment of a class or interface
Whole Sentence: Operation This checkbox allows to hide or show the operations compartment of a class or interface.

Clause: This checkbox allows to reveal or hide the stereotypes of a package
Whole Sentence: Stereotype This checkbox allows to reveal or hide the stereotypes of a package, shown above the name.

Clause: This checkbox allows to hide the visibility of a package
Whole Sentence: Visibility This checkbox allows to hide the visibility of a package.

Clause:
The visibility is shown in
UML notation as +, -, # or ~
Whole Sentence: The visibility is shown in UML notation as +, -, # or ~.

Clause:
This checkbox allows to reveal or hide the extensions points compartment
of a usecase
Whole Sentence: Extension Points This checkbox allows to reveal or hide the extensions points compartment of a usecase.

Clause: This defines the corners of the bounding box for a 2D model element
Whole Sentence: This defines the corners of the bounding box for a 2D model element.

Clause:
It comprises four
numbers separated by commas
Whole Sentence: It comprises four numbers separated by commas.

Clause:
These four numbers are respectively: i) the X coordinate of the upper
left corner of the box; ii) the Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the box; iii) the width of the
box; and iv) the height of the box
Whole Sentence: These four numbers are respectively: i) the X coordinate of the upper left corner of the box; ii) the Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the box; iii) the width of the box; and iv) the height of the box.

Clause: All units are pixels on the editing pane
Whole Sentence: All units are pixels on the editing pane.

Clause: This drop-down selector specifies the fill color for 2D model elements
Whole Sentence: This drop-down selector specifies the fill color for 2D model elements.

Clause:
It is not present for
line model elements
Whole Sentence: It is not present for line model elements.

Clause: Selecting No Fill makes the model element transparant
Whole Sentence: Selecting No Fill makes the model element transparant.

Clause: It causes the color selector dialog box to appear
Whole Sentence: It causes the color selector dialog box to appear, see Figure 13.

Clause: Since UML comments are a kind of documentation, they are also shown on this tab, with name and body.
Whole Sentence: Since UML comments are a kind of documentation, they are also shown on this tab, with name and body.

Clause: shows a typical style tab for a model element in ArgoUML (in this case a class).
Whole Sentence: Style sheets vary a little from model element to model element, but Figure 13.8, " A typical Presentation tab on the details pane " shows a typical style tab for a model element in ArgoUML (in this case a class).

Clause: A text box for the author of the documentation.
Whole Sentence: Author: A text box for the author of the documentation.

Clause: for a model element in ArgoUML.
Whole Sentence: Figure 13.7, " A typical Documentation tab on the details pane " shows a typical documentation tab for a model element in ArgoUML.

Clause: This tab provides some limited control over the graphical representation of model elements in the diagram in the editing pane.
Whole Sentence: This tab provides some limited control over the graphical representation of model elements in the diagram in the editing pane.

Clause: For model elements that require heavy documentation, notably use cases, the use of the See:
Whole Sentence: For model elements that require heavy documentation, notably use cases, the use of the See: field to point to external documents is more practical.

Clause: The other fields similarly store their information under tagged values:
Whole Sentence: The other fields similarly store their information under tagged values:  author, version, since, deprecated, see.

Whole Sentence: A typical Presentation tab on the details pane shows a typical style tab for a model element in ArgoUML (in this case a class).

Clause: The names of all comments attached to the modelelement.
Whole Sentence: The names of all comments attached to the modelelement.

Clause: the ArgoUML Main class would be shown as:
Whole Sentence: It is shown in UML notation with :: seperators. E.g. the ArgoUML Main class would be shown as: org::argouml::application::Main.

Clause: The bodies of all comments attached to this modelelement.
Whole Sentence: The bodies of all comments attached to this modelelement.

Clause: A text box to show how long the documentation has been valid.
Whole Sentence: A text box to show how long the documentation has been valid.

Whole Sentence: There may be further fields in some cases, e.g. for a package, but most fields are common to many model elements.
